title: European Rural Tourism: A Guide to Local Experiences
content:
preparation in advance


Visa: Apply for the corresponding Schengen visa or other visa types based on the country you are in and the European country you are traveling to. For example, if you are a Chinese citizen traveling to Schengen countries, you need to prepare the necessary visa documents in advance, such as passport, photo, itinerary, proof of funds, etc., and submit the application to the local embassy or visa application center.
Ticket and Transportation: Search and book round-trip tickets, and stay tuned for airline promotions in advance to get discounted prices. After arriving in Europe, choose the appropriate mode of transportation based on the travel destination, such as trains, long-distance buses, or renting a car for self driving. In rural areas, self driving is usually the most convenient way of transportation, allowing for more freedom to explore the surrounding scenery.
Accommodation reservation: Based on the travel itinerary, book accommodation in rural areas online in advance. You can choose local homestays, farms, or small hotels to experience the peaceful atmosphere and unique charm of the countryside. Check the evaluation and facilities of the accommodation in advance to ensure a comfortable and safe living environment.
Understand local information: Search for travel guides, historical and cultural materials, and local customs and habits about the destination countryside in order to better integrate into local life and fully experience the fun of rural travel.

Recommended tourist destinations


The Cotswolds region of the UK: There are many picturesque rural towns here, such as Baibury and Waterborne Burton. The town is renowned for its ancient stone buildings, charming countryside scenery, and flowing streams, and is known as the 'heart of England'.


Day 1: Arrive in Baibury and check into a local homestay. Strolling through the streets of Baibury in the afternoon, admiring Arlington townhouses, one of the most representative rural buildings in the UK and a filming location for many movies and TV shows. Take a walk along the Cohen River, enjoying the beautiful scenery and leisurely rural life by the river.
The next day: Go to Waterborne Burton and visit this small town known for its water scenery. Visit the Model Village, where a miniature landscape of Burton on the water is displayed, which is very exquisite and interesting. Enjoy lunch at a riverside restaurant and taste local specialties such as fish and chips, English afternoon tea, etc. In the afternoon, you can choose to rent a bicycle and ride on the rural path to enjoy the surrounding countryside scenery. Passing by some ancient farms and villages, you can feel the tranquility and peace of the countryside.
Day 3: Head to Kumburg, one of the best preserved ancient villages in England. Visit the historic castle, church, and traditional English countryside residences in the village to learn about the local history and culture. Participate in local handicraft workshops, learn to make traditional handicrafts such as ceramics and wood carvings, and experience the traditional skills of rural England.

Cotswold region of the UK: Taste traditional English breakfast, including fried eggs, bacon, sausages, toasted bread, and more. In addition, there are classic dishes such as Shepherd's Pie and Beef Waist Pie, as well as local specialty cheeses such as Cheddar cheese.


Colmar, France: located in the northeast of France, it combines the charm of France and Germany, resembling a scene from a fairy tale. Here, there are antique canals, colorful wooden houses, and streets blooming with flowers, making it an excellent place to experience romantic French countryside life.

Day 1: Arrive in Colmar and check into a hotel or homestay in the town center. In the morning, visit the old town of Colmar, admire the colorful half timbered houses, stroll along the canal, and experience the rich medieval atmosphere. Visit the Bodhi Tree Museum, which houses a large collection of local art and historical artifacts, showcasing the development of Colmar.
The next day: Go to the wine producing area of Colmar and visit the local wineries. Understand the process of wine making and taste various delicious wines such as Riesling and Qiongyao. Enjoy lunch at the winery, paired with local specialties such as French cheese, ham, etc. In the afternoon, you can participate in some outdoor activities such as hiking or cycling, shuttle between vineyards, and enjoy the beautiful countryside scenery.
Day 3: Experience local traditional festivals or markets. If the time is right, you can catch Colmar's Christmas market or other traditional festivals, taste local specialty snacks, buy handicrafts and souvenirs. You can also participate in local cooking classes to learn how to make authentic French rural cuisine, such as French bread, crepes, etc.

French town of Colmar: Enjoy delicious baked goods such as French bread and croissants, paired with coffee or hot chocolate for breakfast. For lunch and dinner, you can taste the special food of Alsace, such as pickled Chinese cabbage stew, flame pancake, French baked snail, etc., and of course, you can also taste the local wine.

Yangjiao Village in the Netherlands: known as the "Venice of the Netherlands", there are no cars or roads, only criss crossing canals and small bridges connecting every household. Here, you can take a boat tour, enjoy the peaceful rural scenery, and feel the tranquility and beauty of nature.

On the first day: After arriving at Yangjiao Village, go to the reserved accommodation to check in and take a break. Then you can rent a small boat and start a boat tour of Yangjiao Village. Slowly walk along the canal, enjoy the beautiful scenery on both sides, and feel the peaceful atmosphere of "small bridges, flowing water, and homes". Along the way, you can see various cute thatched cottages and gardens.
The next day: Visit the farm in Yangjiao Village to learn about Dutch agricultural culture and traditions. You can watch the process of milking cows, making cheese, and personally participate in some simple farming activities, such as picking fruits, vegetables, etc. Enjoy a sumptuous Dutch countryside lunch on the farm at noon, tasting specialty foods such as cheese, ham, potatoes, etc. In the afternoon, go to the local wooden shoe factory to watch the production process of wooden shoes, try on various styles of wooden shoes, and purchase some as souvenirs.
On the third day, we will engage in hiking or cycling activities in the rural areas surrounding Yangjiao Village. Walk along the country road, admire the vast fields, windmills, and distant forests, and feel the beauty of nature. Along the way, you can pass through some small villages, interact with local residents, and learn about their way of life and customs.


Dutch Yangjiao Village: Try traditional Dutch cuisine such as cheese, ham, fried meatballs, etc. In addition, there are local specialty pancakes that can be paired with various fruits, cream, or chocolate sauce, making them very delicious.

Rotenburg, Germany: Known as the "Pearl of the Middle Ages", the city preserves complete medieval streets, buildings, and castles. Strolling along the ancient cobblestone streets, it feels like traveling back to medieval Europe.

Day 1: After arriving in Rottenburg, check into the hotel and rest for a while. In the afternoon, we will begin our tour of the old town of Rottenburg, strolling along the narrow cobblestone streets and admiring the ancient city walls, towers, city hall, and various medieval style buildings. Visit the Rottenburg Castle Garden, which offers a panoramic view of the entire city and is a great place to take photos and memories.
The next day: Participate in a local historical and cultural tour, where you can follow a tour guide or rent audio guidance equipment to gain a deeper understanding of the history and culture of Rotenburg. Visit the Medieval Crime Museum to learn about the laws and penal systems of the Middle Ages; You can also visit St. Jacob's Church and appreciate its exquisite architecture and artistic decoration. At noon, try traditional German food in the local restaurant, such as roast pork elbow, sausage, pickled Chinese cabbage, etc. In the afternoon, go to the handicraft shop in Rotenburg to purchase some locally made handicrafts such as ceramics, wood carvings, handmade toys, etc.
Day 3: Experience outdoor activities in rural Germany, such as hiking or cycling to surrounding rural areas. Appreciate the beautiful rural scenery, pass by some ancient farms and vineyards, and have a picnic by the creek on the way. If time permits, you can also visit local breweries, learn about the brewing process of German beer, and taste fresh beer.

Rothenburg, Germany: Taste the famous German food, such as roast pork elbow, roast sausage, pickled Chinese cabbage, etc., and match with the local beer, the taste is very authentic. In addition, there are also specialty foods such as Schwaben dumplings and Black Forest cake.

Tuscany countryside in Italy: renowned for its beautiful pastoral scenery, ancient estates, and world-renowned wine regions. Here, you can visit wineries, taste delicious wines, and enjoy the stunning scenery of undulating mountains, vineyards, and olive groves.

Day 1: After arriving in the Tuscan countryside, go to the booked farm or villa to check in. In the afternoon, take a walk around the farm and admire the undulating mountains, vineyards, and olive groves, experiencing the beautiful scenery of Tuscan countryside. Visit the grape cellar on the farm, learn about the wine making process, and taste various vintages and varieties of wine.
The next day: Go to nearby towns such as Siena or San Gimignano. In Siena, you can visit famous attractions such as Piazza del Rey and Siena Cathedral to experience the unique charm of this medieval city; In San Gimignano, one can climb up to the tower and overlook the beautiful scenery of the entire town, admiring its unique medieval tower architecture. At noon, taste local specialties such as Italian noodles, pizza, tiramisu, etc. in the small town. In the afternoon, you can participate in some cooking classes or food tours to learn how to make traditional Tuscan cuisine and taste local specialties such as olive oil, ham, cheese, etc.
Day 3: Engage in outdoor activities such as hiking or horseback riding through the countryside of Tuscany. Walk along the mountain path and enjoy the beautiful natural scenery, passing by some ancient farms and castle ruins. You can also choose to relax at the local hot spring baths and enjoy the comfort and contentment brought by the hot springs.

uscany countryside, Italy: Enjoy the essence of Italian cuisine to the fullest, such as handmade pasta, pizza, Florentine steak, and more. The olive oil and wine from Tuscany are also not to be missed, with superior quality and excellent taste.

matters needing attention


Seasonal selection: Different European villages have different characteristics and scenery in different seasons. For example, in spring, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery of blooming flowers, in summer, it is suitable for outdoor activities, in autumn, you can enjoy colorful leaves and harvest scenes, and in winter, you have the opportunity to experience local Christmas markets and festive atmosphere. Choose the appropriate season to go according to your preferences.


Respect local culture: European rural areas usually have their own unique culture and customs, respect the way of life and traditions of local residents, abide by local regulations and etiquette, such as maintaining silence in religious places such as churches and respecting local dining habits.


Language communication: Although English can be used for communication in some popular tourist areas, language barriers may be encountered in some niche rural areas. Learning some commonly used local languages and phrases, such as greetings, ordering phrases, etc., will help to communicate better with the locals.


Currency and Payment: Most European countries use the Euro, but there are also some countries that use their own currency. Understand the currency situation of the destination country in advance and prepare an appropriate amount of cash and suitable payment methods, such as credit cards, debit cards, etc. In some rural areas, cash payments may be more common
section: The mainland, full of historical and cultural heritage, not only has well-known popular tourist cities, but also many niche cities and villages that are like hidden treasures, emitting unique charm and waiting for tourists to explore.
